clinical_study.brief_title: A Based on PEEG and PET Study of Anxiolytic Treatment to Improve Cognitive Function in Patients With Alzheimer Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Based on PEEG and PET Study of Anxiolytic Treatment to Improve Cognitive Function in Patients With Alzheimer Disease

brief_summary.textblock:
Objective: Evaluation the improvement of the cognitive function of tandospirone add-on treatment on patients with AD comorbid anxiety.
Number of Patients: 30
Methodology: Randomized, open-label, parallel-group
Assigned Interventions: Experimental: Tandospirone, 30-60 mg/d + Donepezil, 10 mg/d; Control group: Donepezil, 10 mg/d.
Effect Evaluation: Primary Outcome: Change from baseline in ADAS-cog total score at week 12; NPI scale total score at week 12;

primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in ADAS-cog total score at week 12
NPI scale total score at week 12

secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the relative power at week 12
